snippet: A federal appeals court ordered that some types of emergency contraceptives be made available to women of all ages without a prescription.
abstract: Federal appeals court orders that some types of emergency contraceptives be made available for now to women of all ages without a prescription, adding another layer of confusion to complex and intensely political fight over availability of so-called morning-after pills.

byline.original: By PAM BELLUCK and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court ordered that some types of emergency contraceptives be made available to women of all ages without a prescription.

headline.seo: Judge Orders All Restrictions Lifted on Some Morning-After Pills
headline.main: Judge Orders All Restrictions Lifted on Some ‘Morning-After’ Pills
headline.print_headline: Judge Orders All Restrictions Lifted on Some ‘Morning-After’ Pills
